remarks: If two functions on a base topology ` J ` make the same identifications in order to create quotient spaces ` J qTop F ` and ` J qTop G ` , then not only are ` J qTop F ` and ` J qTop G ` homeomorphic, but there is a unique homeomorphism that makes the diagram commute.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Mar-2015.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 23-Aug-2015.)

qtophmeo.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. X /\ y e. X ) ) -> ( ( F ` x ) = ( F ` y ) <-> ( G ` x ) = ( G ` y ) ) ) $.
qtophmeo $p |- ( ph -> E! f e. ( ( J qTop F ) Homeo ( J qTop G ) ) G = ( f o. F ) ) $.
